ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours when we didn't have an exam. 10 hours with an exam.
4h
I spent between 3 and 6 hours per week outside of class on this course.
4 hrs
2 hrs.
3-6 hours. During the exams, much more.
6 hours/week working on weekly assignments and readings. More time was spent during midterm and finals week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great course, I learned a lot.
good.

This was an excellent course. I think Dr. Mayne took an incredible amount of material and distilled it down to the most important points and key concepts. I was challenged in this course with having to synthesize the key concepts from each lecture in order to prepare for the exams. This was challenging, but extremely helpful. I also appreciated the homework assignments as they helped to bring the materials we learned in class to life.
The course was well-organized, well-designed, and well-taught.
The course is very intuitive.
very good course
Structured teaching was very helpful and organized in such a way to develop from basics to the real-life application.I recommend this course to my colleagues
Great introduction to nutrition and public health. Her lectures are very clear and informative while her tests are fair and well-written.
The course is accessible to students of any background.The tests are thorough, yet fair, making the material difficult to forget.The lectures were the most enjoyable of all my courses this semester.
I think this is a fantastic course!

This course covered all of the big chronic diseases and related it very well to nutrition--in other words, it taught exactly what its title said it would teach. We didn't learn any "useless" material; everything was pretty relevant to the course, which is very much appreciated.

We covered a lot of material in this course, and it left me with a broad, though introductory, understanding of the role of nutrition in preventing and treating disease. Dr. Mayne does a great job of of teaching the material and it is clear that she really cares about us understanding the subject.

Excellent. The course was strong in the amount and depth of material it covered. It was weak in that sometimes the lectures got monotonous without very much student interaction. However, the sections gave students time to interact with the material, largely making up for this lack of interaction during lecture. The course was very thorough and I got even more out of it than I anticipated.
Excellent course.
Really good course, the instructors overall knowledge is the greatest strength.
Great course, the Prof is an expert in the field and it was a honor to take the course with her. While the material is primarily focused on vitamins and nutrients, it was eye opening.
strict
I really enjoyed this class. I learned a lot about vitamins and health and how the food industry markets products to consumers. I learned a lot of useful information for your everyday life.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Susan Mayne  Good lecturer. Interesting material. I think her background as a biochemist really helps.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  good

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne did an excellent job of distilling a large amount of material down to the key concepts for us. The lectures were excellent and I appreciated the time that was taken for questions. I also appreciated that Dr. Mayne attended the Thursday discussion sections with the TA. I think the format worked really well.

Instructor: Susan Mayne  The instructor is clearly passionate about the material and well-informed in her field. She organized the lectures well and she evaluated the students based on the information that she taught (an excellent model). There was little confusion about expectations.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne is very knowledgable and a lot of the informations introduced in the course are very interesting.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  excellent professor

Instructor: Susan Mayne  An amazing instructor. She actually became my favorite teacher at yale public health. The course is very structured and organized to develop knowledge in chronic diseases and nutrition and further it carries to the real-life situation and policies that we'll face. Also changed my way of looking at diseases too.On-going research discussion to keep us up-to -date on the most recent research on nutrition related to diseases is awesome, too.Definitely, helpful and applicable to what i'm going to be doing in the future.p.s.) I just have to comment also that she wears such a professionally nice outfit. A classic professor. like it!

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Professor Mayne is very knowledgeable and a great lecturer. She brings a lot of personal insight into the lectures and discussions. I really enjoyed the lecture/discussion format of the class.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne is well-prepared, clear, and fun. She is also an excellent scientist and, Despite her modesty, it is nevertheless humbling to be in her presence.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  Susan Mayne is extremely knowledgeable, professional, and approachable. Overall she is one of the best instructors I have had at YSPH.

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne knows her stuff, but is not shy about telling you when a question is out of her domain. She lectures well, and always answers questions thoughtfully and thoroughly. Lectures may have been 2 hours, but most of the time it didn't feel that long.

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne is a great teacher and extremely knowledgeable in the subject. I appreciated her presence at discussion sections and she was always happy to answer questions at any point.

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne is a wealth of knowledge on nutrition and chronic disease. She is up to date on most research relating to nutrition and various chronic disease, and can always point to references. She has excellent experience in both policy and lab settings, and often uses examples from her own varied research in class. I would take the course with her again if I had the time!
Instructor: Susan Mayne  Dr. Mayne is a fantastic professor. SHe is extremely knowledgable and always available to students for help, discussion, etc. One of the best professors at Yale.

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Prof Mayne is extrememly impressive and it was a pleasure to take the course with her. The only overall course recommendation I have is that we do focus specifically on vitamins and nutrients, and that an overall understanding of proper diet for prevention and treatment would also be helpful.
Instructor: Susan Mayne  very professional and well-prepared

Instructor: Susan Mayne  Susan is very knowledgeable about this subject matter. Since she is on a lot of the committees that decide the appropriate nutrition information to the public, she has a lot of current knowledge. She was very clear about teaching the subject matter and I took a lot away from the course.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: TA was also good. Helpful with test questions (Yang Zhou)
Excellent.

The TA for this class was excellent. She wasreadily available over email and made time for appointments as necessary. She was also very knowledgeable of the materials and helped to explain key concepts in the discussion sections.
The TA was helpful and approachable.
My TA is Yang Zhou.Yang has been very helpful and the discussion section is well-prepared and conducted.
very approachable very helpful
Very helpful and approchable.
Yang was a great TA. Very prompt at returning homework and great at encouraging discussions.
Yang Zhou was well-prepared, intelligent, approachable, and useful as a resource. She was responsive to emails and presented excellent leadership skills during the sections.
The TA was super nice and helpful whenever I had questions. She led discussions well by making sure there were no long periods of silence.
Yang Zhou was a great TA. She always seemed very prepared for section. Though I didn't seek out her help that much outside of class, when I did she, was always available and quick to respond.
Ying was an excellent TA. Very professional and knowledgeable.
Yang did a great job with section and was always available to help out.
The TA was super nice and patient during the discussion sessions
Although slightly timid in TA sections, Yang was helpful and definitly was well informed on the material.
flexible
The TA was very good at leading discussion section and handing back assignments in a timely manner.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is an overview of the current state of macro and micro nutrients and their use(s) and regulation in the US. Yes, I would recommend this course.Learned a lot.
Some contents need memorizing..
I highly recommend this course to other students. It is an excellent introduction to the field of nutritional epidemiology and has raised my interest in the field.

I would recommend the course. It was very well organized and fairly evaluated. There was a great deal of useful information that was conveyed in an accessible way. It definitely increased my interest in the topic.
It is good to have a general idea about the relationship between nutritional factors and chronic disease, and know where we are right now.
would recommend this course to others
I've already strongly recommended this course to my friends.Valulable learning
Great introductory course to nutrition and public health. Read a lot of great articles and learned about a lot of interesting nutrition& public health studies.
I would highly recommend this course. I woudl also say that it should be a required course for all medical students and graduate students in public health, regardless of their emphasis.
Fantastic introductory course to Chronic Disease nutrition. If anything I just wish there were a second semester of this type of course.
If you're interested in nutrition and chronic diseases, definitely take this course. If not, I would save a class space for something else, since this class is exactly what you think it is.
I would recommend this class to anyone who's interested in an introduction to the role of nutrition in treating and preventing disease.
Excellent course if you are interested in nutrition and any disease. I highly recommend it.
A good course for those really interested in nutrition!
Wonderful course, if interested and nutrition and chronic disease it is a must!
yes
I loved this course and it was one of my favorite courses that I took all semester. I would highly recommend it to others to take.
